revised_title: Stomach Structure and Function in Vertebrates: A Comparative Study
tldr: This study examines the structure and function of the stomach in various vertebrate species, focusing on the dimorphous cell-growth and its relation to the pepsinous power. The author also discusses the role of gastric juice, the influence of temperature on digestion, and the differences between gastric and pancreatic secretions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy and Physiology
